alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 4:42AM PDT until April 05 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LATE SEASON WINTER STORM TO DELIVER HEAVY SNOW TO THE CASCADE CREST... .Snow will increase Sunday evening and become heavy at times into Monday. Snow over the Cascade crest will continue to accumulate through Monday night into Tuesday morning. Winter travel conditions will be likely along Highway 2 from Coles Corner to Stevens Pass. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 18 and 30 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Holden Village, Stehekin, and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds may result in broken tree limbs and power outages. Reduced visibility due to blowing snow will also be possible over Stevens Pass.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
